channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Bicentennial Student Club Showcase Scheduled for November 16
item.description: Date: Saturday, November 16, 2024 12:00 PM - 5:00 PM - In celebration of Rensselaer’s Bicentennial, we invite student clubs to showcase as part of the Bicentennial Campus Carnival event on Anderson Field! For more information, please reach out to Lauren Arnoff or Will O’Brien.
item.author: Students

item.title: Register For HackRPI!
item.description: Date: Saturday, November 9, 2024 - Sun , November 10, 2024 (all day) - This year’s HackRPI will be in the Institute’s 11th annual hackathon, so we want to make sure that as many people know about it as possible! The event will be held in the DCC for participants to hack, eat food, and meet our sponsors. Register now!
item.author: Students

item.title: Applications Now Being Accepted for Arch and Fall 2025 Resident Assistants
item.description: Student Living and Learning is looking for applicants to join their Arch 2025 and Fall 2025 staff, so apply between now and January 31, 2025 to join their team of leaders on campus and help create a community in your residence hall! Qualified applicants will be required to attend both a group and individual interview in October. To learn more, sign up to attend an information session.
item.author: Students

item.title: ASCE to Hold Student Chapter Meeting November 5
item.description: Date: Tuesday, November 5, 2024 6:00 PM - 7:00 PM - Come meet representatives from CDM Smith, including recent alum Matt Nowak. This event is a great way to gain insight into career paths, discover job and internship opportunities, and enjoy pizza with fellow students while gaining advice on launching your professional engineering career!
item.author: Students

item.title: Global Virtual Career Fair for LGBTQ+ Students and Recent Graduates
item.description: Date: November 13, 2024, 12:00 - 3:00 pm. Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute is a proud sponsor of this year’s #WorkFair, a Global Virtual Career Fair for LGBTQ+ Students and Recent Graduates in Europe, Asia, and the Americas. This free event will feature opportunities to attend virtual panels and workshops, engage in live chats with recruiters, and book interviews. Click here for more information and to register
item.author: Students

item.title: Don’t Forget “Coffee & Art” on November 5!
item.description: Date: Tuesday, November 5, 2024 12:00 PM - 2:00 PM - Come to the Mueller Center lobby for this creative and social event, which gives students a chance to enjoy a variety of coffee options while participating in different arts-and-crafts activities in a relaxed atmosphere. It’s a perfect way to unwind, connect with peers, and engage in creative hands-on projects to explore one’s artistic talents!
item.author: Students

item.title: Graduate “Lunch and Learn” Event to Highlight Personal Financial Management
item.description: Date: Wednesday, November 6, 2024 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM - During this session, Professor Johan Maharjan will present insight into personal financial management, discuss the core areas of managing personal finance, and offer strategies for budgeting, tackling debt, using credit cards, saving for retirement, and much more. Limited seating for this hybrid event will be available in the CBIS Bruggeman Room, or participants can attend via Webex. Lunch will be served from 11-11:30 AM.
item.author: Students

item.title: “If You Could Go Anywhere In the World, Where Would You Go?” Topic of November 6 Fulbright Info Session
item.description: Date: Wednesday, November 6, 2024 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM - Want to complete your thesis or dissertation research, earn a graduate degree, or teach English in one of 140 countries? Students with a bachelor’s degree who are ready to travel in the Fall of 2026 are encouraged to register or drop by to attend this session discussing how to select and apply for a Fulbright Award….
item.author: Students

item.title: CEE Seminar Series to Continue November 6
item.description: Date: Wednesday, November 6, 2024 1:00 PM - 2:00 PM - In a talk titled “Recent Advances in Liquefaction Experimentation and Analysis Techniques,” Dr. Kyohei Ueda, Professor of the Disaster Prevention Research Institute, Kyoto University, will discuss how, in the field of geotechnical earthquake engineering, ongoing research focuses on centrifuge model tests and effective stress analyses to clarify the mechanisms behind the seismic behavior of liquefiable soils and to evaluate their responses.
item.author: Community

item.title: William H. Rauscher Memorial Lecture Scheduled for November 5
item.description: Date: Tuesday, November 5, 2024 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - The Department of Chemistry’s seminar series continues with the 45th William H. Rauscher Memorial Lecture featuring Gary Wnek, Professor of Macromolecular Science and Engineering at Case Western Reserve University, who will speak about “Uncommon Observations with Common Polymers: Implications and Applications.”
item.author: Community

item.title: iEAR to Present Talk by Francois-Joseph Lapointe on November 6
item.description: As part of HASS’ Art, Science & Religion series, join iEAR from 5:00PM to 6:30PM on Wednesday, November 6 in the CBIS Auditorium for a talk by Francois-Joseph Lapointe, who will discuss how the transmission of the microbiome at birth plays a crucial role in shaping an individual’s health and development, representing a dynamic interplay between maternal and neonatal microbial communities.
item.author: Community

item.title: Concert of Contemporary Music to Feature Works by Oliveros, Riley
item.description: Wednesday, November 6, 2024 7:00 PM - 9:00 PM - This concert of contemporary music feature works by Pauline Oliveros and Terry Riley, performed by music students and faculty. The program includes Oliveros’s “The C(s) for Once” (1966) for flutes, trumpets, vocalists and tape-delay system, which has not been performed since the 1960s.
item.author: Community

item.title: “Ethics: Some Finer Points” Discussion Scheduled for November 8
item.description: Date: Friday, November 8, 2024 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - When faced with an ethical issue in our work, we typically first make sure we understand the issue, then often seek guidance in our engineering specialty’s code of ethics, make a decision, and implement it. Register to join Prof. Azita Hirsa and Stuart G. Walesh, Ph.D., P.E. (ret) for this insightful discussion!…
item.author: Community

item.title: Faculty/Staff Workshop to Review Supported On-Campus Polling Tools for Courses, Meetings
item.description: Date: Monday, November 11, 2024 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - This workshop will review a couple of polling software tools — iClicker, Slido, and the free version of Kahoot! — that are available and supported on campus, and discuss the differences as to when you might consider using one over the other. Space for the session is limited, so please register by November 6.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: MBA for Professionals Review to be Held November 5
item.description:
Date: Tuesday, November 5, 2024 7:00 PM - 7:30 PM - Register to join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph. D., as he reviews this innovative project-based, online MBA for professionals program. Participants will learn to lead from every aspect of an organization with real-world MBA experience, prepare to lead the most dynamic and innovative organizations, and engage, involve, motivate, and lead others to reach their fullest potential.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
